alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Nance; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 2:40AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Greeley, northwestern Nance and northeastern Valley Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 239 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Fort Hartsuff State Park to near Cotesfield. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wolbach around 255 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Spalding and Belgrade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
